short-title.#text:
Niblack and Bokan Mountain Mining
			 Area Roads Authorization Act

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

header.#text:
Niblack and
			 Bokan Mountain mining area road corridors

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall, for purposes of connecting the Prince of
			 Wales Island road system in the State of Alaska to the area of the Niblack and
			 Bokan Mountain patented mineral claims on the southeast side of Prince of Wales
			 Island, establish—

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any prohibition against
			 road construction in inventoried roadless areas under the Roadless Area
			 Conservation Rule established under part 294 of title 36, Code of Federal
			 Regulations (and successor regulations), not later than 180 days after the date
			 of enactment of this Act, the

quote.#text:
Road to Niblack Mine and Bokan Mountain
			 Route Extension

text.#text:
a road corridor that follows 1 of the 2
			 routes identified as

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Niblack and Bokan Mountain Mining Area Roads Authorization Act/s:2/ss:a/p:1

text.#text:
a road corridor to the Bokan Mountain mine
			 that branches off the Niblack Mine road corridor established under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Niblack and Bokan Mountain Mining Area Roads Authorization Act/s:2/ss:a

text.#text:
minimize the
			 economic costs of the road corridor by using, to the maximum extent
			 practicable, the road network in existence on the date of the
			 establishment;

minimize effects
			 of the road corridor on surface resources;

prevent
			 unnecessary or unreasonable surface disturbance; and

comply with all
			 applicable laws (including regulations).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Niblack and Bokan Mountain Mining Area Roads Authorization Act/s:2/ss:a

text.#text:
The State of Alaska and the Prince of Wales Community
			 Advisory Council may participate as cooperating agencies during the preparation
			 of any environmental impact statement prepared with respect to a road corridor
			 under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that any Federal permit
			 required for construction of a road corridor established under

be issued or denied by the date that is not later than 1 year after the date of
			 application for the permit.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Niblack and Bokan Mountain Mining Area Roads Authorization Act/s:2/ss:a

current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To authorize the establishment of the Niblack and Bokan
		  Mountain mining area road corridors in the State of Alaska, and for other
		  purposes.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Energy and Natural
			 Resources

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was read twice and referred to the
